newsitem.title: USA: US Diagnostic to restate 96 qrtly results.
newsitem.headline: US Diagnostic to restate 96 qrtly results.

text.p: US Diagnostic Inc said on Monday it would be restating its 1996 quarterly results because of $20.6 million in unusual, one-time or non-cash charges which hurt its full-year results.

The company reported a net earnings loss of $0.47 per diluted share in 1996 compared with a profit of $0.60 per diluted share the previous year. Revenues for the year ended December 31, 1996, were $102.1 million against $28.8 million the year before, it said.
Some of the unusual items resulted from accounting firm Arthur Andersen recommending different accounting treatment than the company previously reported, it said.
Charges and unusual items totalling $20.6 million included $5.51 million for Coyote Consulting Commissions paid on acquisitions and non-cash expenses related to stock options, the company said.

Retroactive accounting for five 1996 acquisitions was adjusted to reflect the actual closing dates instead of contractually agreed upon dates, for a $4.08 million adjustment in pre-tax income, the company said.
